comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
When we’re they not lost?
Not the grand old party

"Man changed party from Republican to Democrat"

Wow, what a story
I went to vote yesterday and was blown away by how many people were queued on a Friday in an off-year election. Here's hoping VA can stay blue, it's done some great things for us imo.
This is Terry McA’s _only_ virtue: not being a Republican in 2021.  I voted for him, but was incredibly angry that I had to do so.
Honesty is what normal people want of elected officials. Without that all else is meaningless. Anyone supporting the big lie is totally dishonest and has been manipulated "bigly."
THIS IS THE WAY to rid the country of the radicals and fascists that are now the Republican Party. The Republican party no longer serves our democracy it ACTIVELY seeks to undermine it.
the real walk away
Can we vote third party because both parties are fundamentally and intrinsically fucking crazy?
For anyone reading this and lives in VA, please tell your friends/family/acquaintances to vote and pick wisely.
Good luck on Tuesday. Not looking good for the Macker.

The Republican Party is what it is now because of 2008, the Tea Party, and the freedom caucus. This is what led to Trump’s election.

Now the democrats are going through a very similar situation within their own party. Do you think things will end up differently for democrats than it did for republicans?

Virginia Democrat are Nazi sympathizers, and like to go out dressed as Nazis. Virginia’s Governor, a Democrat, is best known for blackface and justifying killing already born babies. 

Democrats in Virginia especially are rotten to the core
One thing you have to give the republicans. They make good on their promises and fulfill their voters wishes. Democrats do not, not at all.
Don’t want to disappoint this sub but if Dems win Virginia I will be very surprised. This is also not a good sign for mid terms.

Alternative take: Dems have abandoned progressivism and now conservatives feel at home in the party. 

We'll see if the conservatives they pick up offset the progressives they lose.

why would you even associate with the terrorist criminal conspiracy group known as the gop. they should be branded a terrorist group by our government. so no you are not going to get any sympathy if you purposely chose to associate with them.

"The GOP has lost its way"

I feel fairly confident that the GOP is doing what it has always done, just louder.
Personal whataboutism.. why should we care lol

I left the GOP this year and changed my voting registration to Democrat. I can no longer in good conscience support the GOP as its changed to a party of hate and conspiracy that wants to install a dictator. I honestly don't see myself as a Democrat but I am definitely not what the Republicans are now.

This election is on Tuesday.

Glenn Youngkin wants to institute a Texas-style abortion ban.  He thinks Trump won the 2020 election.  He's been very cagey about his support for Trump, but he'd bring in the same policies we spent four years fighting against.

This weekend, thousands of Americans are calling, texting, and knocking doors in Virginia to make sure Terry McAuliffe wins.  Want to do your part?  Come to r/VoteDEM and get signed up to help!

It all about how much you can tolerate. My tolerance for the toxicity of the GOP reached top level on the first term of George W. Bush. No regrets since. I only wish that the independents and the Democrats could work together and unite for the good of the country as Republicans do. They lost their way they lost their minds they live in this, I don't know how to describe it. But they have in the past work as a unit. In that I have to say they are really good,  presenting a United front.

Okay, y'all can rail at this person all you want. But they are not running for office, and they are saying they're voting for the Democrat, because they no longer believe in the gop. I like it when people wake up.
Let’s go Brandon!
If you were a Republican and remained so anytime in the last 10 years, you are too toxic to vote for. We don’t need anymore Joe Manchins
If you care about the Country and you are Republican, you need to leave it.  Trump hijacked your party and turned it into a toxic anti-American cult
